image.altText: albanese dutton split

props.synopsis: Leaders lock in third debate. Follow live.

title.children: Liberal Party writes to AEC over Spender comments, leaders lock in final debate

image.altText: a woman in a factory with boxes and a bag

props.synopsis: From toy brands to fashion labels, some Australian firms are facing tariffs way above the 10 per cent "baseline". Company owners say they are not getting enough support as they navigate soaring tariffs to send Chinese-made goods into the US.

title.children: The Australian companies facing China-sized tariffs on US imports

image.altText: Donald Trump wears a black cap with gold lettering that says 'Make America Great Again'.

props.synopsis: It seems only a matter of time before Donald Trump uses a crisis and the National Emergencies Act to bring about a revolution in the United States.

title.children: Trump's order on showerheads seems trivial but it's a subtle power grab

image.altText: four politicians wearing high vis at a construction site

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says he wants to see house prices "steadily increase", as both leaders face questions over major policies targeting Australia's housing crisis.

title.children: Dutton says he wants house prices to 'steadily increase' in Australia

image.altText: a male politician wearing a suit waving at a lectern

props.synopsis: The housing debate ramps up, a Coalition senator makes a Trumpian sartorial choice and (most) former prime ministers turn out to help their parties.

title.children: Housing debate heats up, Liberals drop a diss track and senator has a MAGA moment

image.altText: Bob Katter smiling in his office.

props.synopsis: Herding Bob Katter is not an easy task for his long-suffering but loyal staff, who battle to keep him on message. But when he wanders, it can turn into viral gold.

title.children: Bob Katter's never lost for words, but there's one topic that's off limits

image.altText: A micro chip seen on a circuit board

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says new levies on semiconductor imports into the US will be announced in the coming week, with their "national security" impacts to be investigated.

title.children: Trump to impose new chip tariffs, including on electronics exempted days ago

image.altText: Cyclist Melissa Hoskins smiles during an interview.

props.synopsis: The mother of former Olympic cyclist Melissa Hoskins has told an Adelaide court she accepts her daughter's death was a "tragic accident".

title.children: Mother of Melissa Hoskins says Olympian's death was a 'tragic accident'

image.altText: Sleepbus founder Simon Rowe driving a bus at a fundraising event in Coffs Harbour.

props.synopsis: Residents who donated $100,000 for a sleeper bus for rough sleepers are outraged after being told it would be delivered to another community.

title.children: Residents furious after $100k homeless bus sent to different region

image.altText: Willie Rioli holding a footy on field with other players

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide player Willie Rioli posted to social media to explain his "hatred" of the Hawks stems from his family's historical relationship with the club.

title.children: Willie Rioli's 'hatred' of Hawthorn outlined in deleted social media post

image.altText: Rory McIlroy holds his head as the crowd celebrates behind him

props.synopsis: Rory McIlroy has finally achieved golfing immortality in a modern masterpiece of sporting theatre, its flawed brilliance so relatable and so wonderfully symbolic of the Northern Irishman's career as a whole.

title.children: One of sport's greatest final-day battles ends with McIlroy's name in lights

image.altText: White cattle on red dirt stares at the camera with blue sky and low dry shrub in the background.

props.synopsis: Northern Australia's cattle industry is once again battling the government at the Federal Court, seeking compensation that reflects its losses from the export ban.

title.children: Federal Court to decide cattle industry payout for 2011 live export ban

image.altText: Cassius pictured at a horse track

props.synopsis: A man accused of murdering Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey tells a Perth court that he saved the teenager as he was being assaulted by a co-accused, and then checked on his welfare.

title.children: Man accused of Cassius Turvey murder tells court he tried to help teenager

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX is higher after Federal Reserve bosses' assurances sparked a Wall Street rally. Meanwhile China has retaliated to tariffs with a rare earths export ban. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX rises after Wall Street rallies on Fed's assurances, China bans rare earths exports

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: We're only at that start of the pain: J.P. Morgan
US markets poised to open higher

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: Both major parties used their campaign launches over the weekend to highlight housing announcements targeted squarely at first home buyers. Here's what you need to know about what they're promising.

title.children: Battle of the first home buyer pledges: What the policies will mean for you

image.altText: Two men dressed as Margaret Pomeranz and David Stratton

props.synopsis: In 2003, beloved film critic Margaret Pomeranz was arrested for trying to screen a banned film. More than 20 years later, the incident has inspired a comedy show.

title.children: In 2003, Margaret Pomeranz was arrested. That story is now a comedy show

image.altText: two men facing one another on a dark background one is red and one is blue

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton are vying for your vote. Here’s what sets them apart.

title.children: What sets two of Australia's most powerful men apart from each other

image.altText: Three primary school kids holding up small whiteboards and smiling

props.synopsis: One in three Australian students are failing to reach proficiency in maths, and according to a new report, many teachers lack the confidence to teach it.

title.children: 'Faddish' teaching practices blamed for Aussie kids' maths failures

image.altText: A graphic showing a calculator, maths symbols, a ruler and a hand holding a pen

props.synopsis: How are your maths skills? Have a crack at these questions for Year 8 students and see how you compare.

title.children: Can you pass Year 8 maths? Take this quiz to find out

image.altText: A man wearing a black singlet and hat with long white hair standing in front of surfboards.

props.synopsis: A small beachside community has been devastated by the drowning deaths of two tourists in what Surf Life Saving Queensland describes as "an absolute tragedy”.

title.children: Coastal town rocked by 'horrific' drowning deaths of UK tourists

image.altText: NSW Police officers scour a property on Fernleigh Close, Windellama after a boy was accidentally shot

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to the property in Windellama, near Goulburn, after a firearm was accidentally discharged.

title.children: Two charged after boy killed in accidental shooting on rural NSW property

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a desk and gestures with his hands while speaking.

props.synopsis: A high school student has been charged with murdering his parents in order to gain the financial means to assassinate US President Donald Trump.

title.children: US teen accused of killing parents as part of Trump assassination plot

image.altText: Two piggy banks on a see-saw, a larger pig weighing a side down, the challenge of financial equality in relationships.

props.synopsis: Experts say it is common for women to walk away with less than they are entitled to when it comes to superannuation in divorce or during a separation.

title.children: Why super can feel 'tricky' to navigate for women going through divorce

image.altText: a man looks up at a wind turbine

props.synopsis: The Franz family moved to Diamondy, 280 kilometres north-west of Brisbane, for its tranquil nature, but now find themselves surrounded by looming towers.

title.children: Twelve of Australia's tallest wind turbines will surround retired couple's home

image.altText: Donald Trump with his hand in the air as he disembarks a plane

props.synopsis: The details of President Donald Trump's most recent physical exam are revealed, with his doctor saying he is "fully fit" to serve.

title.children: Donald Trump 'fully fit' to serve as president, doctor says

image.altText: Russian President Vladimir Putin speaks during a news conference.

props.synopsis: In the world of Chinese social media, you don't have to look far to find them — posts encouraging people to join the Russian army are being circulated on accounts with tens of thousands of followers.

title.children: 'Real men are here': The posts luring Chinese men to join Putin's army

image.altText: Russia's ambassador to Australia accuses International Criminal Court of bias

props.synopsis: Russia's long-serving ambassador to Australia quietly packs up and returns to Moscow, and there's uncertainty about when his replacement will be approved.

title.children: Russian ambassador leaves Canberra amid uncertainty over replacement

image.altText: MVDP is hit by a bidon

props.synopsis: Mathieu van der Poel accuses a fan of "attempted manslaughter" after a full bottle of water hit him in the face during the closing stages of the Paris-Roubaix cycling classic.

title.children: Fan accused of 'attempted manslaughter' after throwing water bottle at cyclist

image.altText: newspaper clippers with men in black outfits holding a white nationalist banner

props.synopsis: Federal election candidates and elected officials are sharing content from The Noticer, a news site regularly publishing articles promoting white supremacist and neo-Nazi ideologies.

title.children: Neo-Nazis say a news site is their 'biggest weapon' and candidates are spreading it

image.altText: Ruby Gill sits at a piano stool facing out, her arms wrapped around herself. She's got dark hair with a fringe and glasses

props.synopsis: Ruby Gill was born and raised in Johannesburg, South Africa, but now the musician calls Australia home. She talks about her new album, touring the country in a tent and the lessons we can learn from animals.

title.children: Ruby Gill didn't realise she was queer until she wrote this song

image.altText: A man in a check shirt leans on a gate

props.synopsis: South Australian independent MP Nick McBride is facing multiple counts of assaulting a person known to him, after he was arrested and charged last week.

title.children: South Australian MP Nick McBride arrested and charged with assault

image.altText: A drone photo overlooking the Tanami mine, you can see a big pit with infrastructure in the background.

props.synopsis: One of the country's most remote mines is getting a billion-dollar upgrade, taking gold production deeper into the Tanami Desert as gold prices hit record highs.

title.children: Australia's remote desert mine plans for 40 more golden years

image.altText: A smiling blonde woman and a grey-haired man smile while standing next a tuna catch on a waterfront.

props.synopsis: Australian tuna producers are cheering after the industry received a sustainability certification following years of hard work.

title.children: World-first certification for once 'severely overfished' Australian tuna

props.synopsis: The rental crisis remains one of Australia’s biggest issues as rent rises increasingly outpace wage growth. Families on an average income have been priced out of a third of postcodes in five capital cities, with Perth now overtaking Sydney as the least affordable place to rent.

title.children: How the rental crisis is changing our cities
